lesson.title: Addition and Subtraction
objectives: Enhance number sense through addition and subtraction
Develop problem-solving skills using realistic scenarios
lesson.overview: This lesson focuses on reinforcing basic addition and subtraction skills through computation practice and realistic word problems.

introduction.description: Introduce basic strategies for addition and subtraction, emphasizing the importance of lining up numbers by place value and carefully reading word problems.
instructions: Explain the importance of lining up numbers by place value.
Discuss strategies for approaching word problems, such as underlining key information.

activity.description: Students will complete worksheets with a mix of computation and word problems to enhance their addition and subtraction skills.

teacherIntroduction.script: Today, we are going to practice addition and subtraction. We will work on lining up numbers correctly and solving word problems by finding key information.

whiteboardExamples.title: Addition Example
steps: Write the numbers one below the other, lining up by place value.
Start adding from the rightmost column.
Carry over if the sum is 10 or more.
whiteboardExamples.teachingPoint: Remember to align numbers by place value.

whiteboardExamples.title: Subtraction Example
steps: Write the numbers one below the other, lining up by place value.
Subtract starting from the rightmost column.

whiteboardExamples.title: Word Problem Example
whiteboardExamples.problem: Samantha has 15 apples. She gives away 7. How many apples does she have left?
steps: Determine the operation needed (subtract in this case).
whiteboardExamples.teachingPoint: Underline key information in word problems.

problems.question: A store has 12 balloons. They sell 5. How many balloons are left?
Liam has 20 candies. He eats 8. How many does he have now?
A basket has 10 apples. 3 more are added. How many apples in total?
There are 16 oranges in a box. 7 are removed. How many remain?
A store has 12 balloons. They sell 5. How many balloons are left?
Liam has 20 candies. He eats 8. How many does he have now?
A basket has 10 apples. 3 more are added. How many apples in total?
There are 16 oranges in a box. 7 are removed. How many remain?
A library has 300 books. They add 125 more. How many books now?
Sarah has 500 stickers. She gives away 215. How many left?
A farmer has 1,000 chickens. He sells 450. How many remain?
A factory makes 600 toys a day. They sell 245. How many left?

worksheet.title: Addition and Subtraction Practice
worksheet.instructions: Solve the addition and subtraction problems below. For word problems, underline the key information.

sections.title: Introduction
sections.instructions: Review these examples to understand how to solve the problems.

items.content: Samantha has 15 apples. She gives away 7. How many apples does she have left? (15 - 7 = 8)

sections.title: Activity
sections.instructions: Complete all the problems. Check your answers.

items.content: A store has 12 balloons. They sell 5. How many are left?
Liam has 20 candies. He eats 8. How many now?
A basket has 10 apples. 3 more are added. Total apples?
There are 16 oranges in a box. 7 are removed. How many remain?

accommodations: Provide additional time for reading word problems
Use highlighters to underline key information

worksheet.title: Advanced Addition and Subtraction Practice
worksheet.instructions: Solve the following problems and ensure to double-check your calculations.

sections.title: Introduction
sections.instructions: Review these examples to ensure you understand the process.

items.content: A library has 300 books. They add 125 more. How many books now? (300 + 125 = 425)

sections.title: Activity
sections.instructions: Solve each problem. Write down your work.

items.content: A library has 300 books. They add 125 more. Total books?
Sarah has 500 stickers. She gives away 215. How many left?
A farmer has 1,000 chickens. He sells 450. How many remain?
A factory makes 600 toys a day. They sell 245. How many left?

accommodations: Allow extra time for detailed responses
Encourage organized work with clear steps

validationErrors: Lesson materials: Must specify "only" when listing materials
Teacher lesson plan: Introduction materials must be an array
